title: Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering (Land) | Singapore Institute of Technology

The Gift that Keeps on Giving
Leading programme for the land transport industry in Singapore

The Bachelor of Engineering with Honours in Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering (Land) is a three-year direct honours degree programme, comprising various fundamental engineering disciplines, such as railway, mechanical, electrical, and electronic engineering.

This programme nurtures individuals to achieve excellence in the ever-changing world of the land transport industry. Students will undergo rigorous academic training provided by highly qualified professors while immersing themselves in the land transport industry through work-study stints with established organisations such as LTA, SMRT, SBS Transit, Singapore Technologies, railway original equipment manufacturers and suppliers.
Students who perform well in the BEng (Hons) programme may proceed to pursue the
Master of Science in Mechanical Engineering

programme. Graduates with MSc in Mechanical Engineering qualification will be eligible for future registration as a Chartered Engineer (CEng) in the UK and Commonwealth countries and/or a Professional Engineer (PE) in Singapore. This unique curriculum design also allows students to attain the professional NDT Level II or NDT Level III (Partial) certification.
Vision: To be the leading programme for the land transport industry in Singapore.
Mission: To nurture individuals to achieve excellence in the ever-changing world of the land transport industry.
Rolling Stock and Permanent Way Systems

Graduates of the Master of Science (Mechanical Engineering) with Bachelor of Engineering in Sustainable Infrastructure Engineering (Land) programmes, after working for three to five years, are expected to be:
Competent in solving complex problems in land transport through the application of critical thinking and relevant up-to-date technical skills and knowledge.
Able to embrace challenges and opportunities by adapting to changes in the technological and business environment through lifelong professional development.
Able to communicate effectively, act with integrity, and have the interpersonal skills needed to lead and nurture teams resulting in transformative outcomes.
Able to serve the community with due consideration of health and safety, societal, and environmental aspects.
Graduates can look forward to careers in various land transport organisations such as
Railway Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Suppliers

Integrated Work Study Programme provides students with the opportunity to undertake real work. Held over the span of eight months, it is designed to be more in-depth than a traditional internship. You will gain real work experience and apply the theories you learn in class with actual practice.

Regional Immersion In Sustainable Engineering (RISE) will create opportunities for students to visit key infrastructure facilities and projects in the region. Students will gain first-hand experience in communicating with engineers, designers and operators who are working on various phases of a project such as those in design, construction, operation and maintenance. RISE will be an eye-opener that will enrich students' learning experiences.
Graduates can look forward to working in, but not limited to, the following occupational fields:
Railway Original Equipment Manufacturers and Suppliers
Rolling Stock and Permanent Way Systems
Railway Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition

The programme structure is subject to change without prior notice. SIT regularly reviews its curriculum to ensure that it remains industry-relevant and prepares our students for the evolving needs of industry.
Diploma holders from any of the five local polytechnics,  A level / IB Diploma graduates, and holders of equivalent Year 12 qualifications are welcome to apply.
Holders of the following BCA Academy Diplomas are eligible to apply:
Diploma in Electrical Engineering and Clean Energy
Diploma in Mechanical Engineering (Green Building Technology)

Applicants with a relevant engineering background i.e. Diploma in Aerospace, Mechanical, Mechatronics or Electrical Engineering, may apply for exemption from modules of up to a maximum of two trimesters.
Applicants with a non-relevant engineering background i.e. Diploma from other engineering disciplines, exemption of modules will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
The members of the Industry Advisory Committee for this programme are:
Group Director, Rail/Road Systems Engineering Director
Executive Vice President, Engineering and Chief Digital Transformation Officer
